question:
Of the eight students—George, Helen, Irving, Kyle, Lenore, Nina, Olivia, and Robert—in a seminar, exactly six will give individual oral reports during three consecutive days—Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday. Exactly two reports will be given each day—one in the morning and one in the afternoon—according to the following conditions: Tuesday is the only day on which George can give a report. Neither Olivia nor Robert can give an afternoon report. If Nina gives a report, then on the next day Helen and Irving must both give reports, unless Nina's report is given on Wednesday.

If Kyle and Lenore do not give reports, then the morning reports on Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, respectively, could be given by
A) Helen, George, and Nina
B) Irving, Robert, and Helen
C) Nina, Helen, and Olivia
D) Olivia, Robert, and Irving
E) Robert, George, and Helen
chain_of_thought: We know Olivia and Robert can't give afternoon reports. Kyle and Lenore don't give reports, so they can't be in any slot. George can only give a report on Tuesday. If Nina gives a report, Helen and Irving must give reports the next day. With these constraints, we can eliminate options with Olivia or Robert in the morning on Monday and Tuesday. Option B and C are also eliminated because they include Irving and Olivia, who can't be in the morning. This leaves options A and E, both including George on Tuesday and Helen or Robert on Monday. Since Nina can only give a report on Tuesday if Helen or Irving must give reports on Wednesday, the morning report on Wednesday can't be Nina's, leaving only Helen or Robert. Option E is eliminated because it has Robert on Monday and Olivia on Tuesday, which is not allowed. Therefore, the correct answer must be A.
full_output:
<think>We know Olivia and Robert can't give afternoon reports. Kyle and Lenore don't give reports, so they can't be in any slot. George can only give a report on Tuesday. If Nina gives a report, Helen and Irving must give reports the next day. With these constraints, we can eliminate options with Olivia or Robert in the morning on Monday and Tuesday. Option B and C are also eliminated because they include Irving and Olivia, who can't be in the morning. This leaves options A and E, both including George on Tuesday and Helen or Robert on Monday. Since Nina can only give a report on Tuesday if Helen or Irving must give reports on Wednesday, the morning report on Wednesday can't be Nina's, leaving only Helen or Robert. Option E is eliminated because it has Robert on Monday and Olivia on Tuesday, which is not allowed. Therefore, the correct answer must be A.</think>
<ans>A</ans>
hint_sentence: Since Nina's report means Helen and Irving must report on Wednesday, Nina cannot give the report on Monday or Tuesday, leaving Helen or Robert for those days.
